answers.answer: I believe u can fly all the way up to late 3rd trimester then it is prohibitted and not a good idea anyways.

i was told until 36 weeks was OK. I flew at 34 weeks and got very swollen. But that could have been a precursor to my preeclampsia. when you fly, make sure to drink plenty of water and get up and stretch often and you should be fine.
Last 4 weeks you can't without maybe a doctor's note. I was 34 wks, they didn't even ask. Go now, I think 2nd trimester is the recommended time!

i was around 31-32 weeks and i had fred flinstone feet during and after.  i believe it could have cause my baby to come early, but who knows.  disneyland while pg?  you should (ok im going to be pigheaded lol) consider a place where mom doesnt have to sit out and not ride rides, get tired and more swollen than the plane ride, and maybe find a beach or sea world where you can sit and everyone can enjoy everything together.  that is my opinion though......
I agree with pertykitty.....you are going to be miserable! But if its what you want to do, go for it! Just double check with your doc first!

question: We are planning a vacation to California when I will be 24 weeks pregnant... I was huge at 24 weeks for my last pregnancy but still went on normally...What are the airline guidelines? Anyone fly at 24 weeks? Any advise?This would be such a welcomed vacation, and a chance for us to spend a last vacation as a family of 3, and aslo we could spend my son's birthday in Disneyland.. what a great way to celebrate a fourth b-day!
title: Until what week can I fly? Please advise
